Quick search

cl_plot¶

cl_plot [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

help configuration and process management commands.

Options

VALUE OPTIONS:

-c, --config <config>¶
-ca, --configalias <configalias>¶

store config in alias section. use to store multiplesettings for same command

-oc, --outconfig <outconfig>¶

FLAGS (DEFAULT TRUE):

--inputalias, --no-inputalias¶

if true uses -ca for loading settings [default: True]

FLAGS (DEFAULT FALSE):

--version¶

Show the version and exit. [default: False]

bar¶

cl_plot bar [OPTIONS] DATAF

dataf should be a tsv or csv with the following format: xaxis label, series1 ,series2, etc.. category1, 0,0,… category2, 0,0,… etc…,…

arguments:

  • dataf: data file to plot

Arguments

DATAF¶

Required argument

Options

VALUE OPTIONS:

-alpha <alpha>¶

transparency for background [default: 0.5]

-axes <axes>¶

enter as xname,xmin,xmax,yname,ymin,ymax - default usesmin and max of data enter xmin etc to maintain autoscale [default: X,0,10,Y,0,ymax]

-background <background>¶

background image for graph area

-bg <bg>¶

background color [default: white]

-bottom <bottom>¶

use with polar to set bottom of y-axis same units as axes [default: 0.0]

-brng <brng>¶

range within axes limits that bars are plotted [default: 0 1]

-bwidth <bwidth>¶

relative width of bars [default: 0.8]

-colors <colors>¶

cmap name* or space seperated list of rgb tuples 0,0,0 120,120,120 etc. if fewer than # series picks .from gradient includes ru_colors: ‘blu’, ‘org’, ‘pur’, ‘red’, ‘blg’, ‘mag’, ‘brn’, ‘grn’, ‘yel’, ‘ggr’, ‘dark’, ‘med’, ‘light’, ‘xlight’ [default: med]

-comment <comment>¶

regex “^[{}].*” indicating comment line indicator [default: #]

-dpi <dpi>¶

image dpi [default: 200]

-drange <drange>¶

index range for data series, if None gets all

-ecolors <ecolors>¶

marker edge colors [default: 1,1,1]

-epositions <epositions>¶

if cmap is a list positions are the mapping pointselse positions are the sample points used to remap

-estep <estep>¶

steps for color map

-ew <ew>¶

bar edge width [default: 0]

-fcol <fcol>¶

colormap position for first color [default: 0.0]

-fg <fg>¶

foreground color [default: black]

-height <height>¶

image height [default: 5.0]

-labels <labels>¶

input custom series labels, by default uses file name and index or –header option

-outf <outf>¶

graph output file (defaults to basename of first dataf)

-positions <positions>¶

if cmap is a list positions are the mapping points else positions are the sample points used to remap

-rwidth <rwidth>¶

relative width of bar clusters [default: 0.95]

-step <step>¶

steps for color map

-width <width>¶

image width [default: 10.5]

-xlabels <xlabels>¶

input custom xaxis labels, by default uses file name androw number or –xheader option

-xticks <xticks>¶

number of x-ticks/gridlines

-y_vals <y_vals>¶

index for yvals [default: -1]

-yticks <yticks>¶

number of y-ticks/gridlines

FLAGS (DEFAULT TRUE):

--legend, --no-legend¶

include legend in plot [default: True]

--polar0, --no-polar0¶

plot center of first bar at xmin [default: True]

--polarauto, --no-polarauto¶

ignore x-axis min,max and plot 0-60 [default: True]

FLAGS (DEFAULT FALSE):

--areaonly, --no-areaonly¶

only plot plot area, no legend or axes, for use as background [default: False]

--front, --no-front¶

plot background in front of data [default: False]

--header, --no-header¶

indicates that data has a header row to get series labels (overridden by labels) [default: False]

--polar, --no-polar¶

plot on polar axes [default: False]

--rows, --no-rows¶

get data rows instead of columns [default: False]

--stacked, --no-stacked¶

make stacked bars [default: False]

--ticklines, --no-ticklines¶

plot tick lines [default: False]

--weatherfile, --no-weatherfile¶

input files will be read as weather files: 0 month, 1 day, 2 hour, 3 dirnorn, 4 difhoriz, 5 globhoriz, 6 skycover [default: False]

--xgrid, --no-xgrid¶

plot x grid lines [default: False]

--xheader, --no-xheader¶

indicates that data has a header column to get x-axis labels (overridden by xlabels) [default: False]

--ygrid, --no-ygrid¶

plot y grid lines [default: False]

--ylog, --no-ylog¶

plot y on log scale [default: False]

HELP:

-opts, --opts¶

check parsed options [default: False]

--debug¶

show traceback on exceptions [default: False]

box¶

cl_plot box [OPTIONS] ARG1

create histogram from data files.

Todo

generate script options and write def

Arguments

ARG1¶

Required argument

Options

HELP:

-opts, --opts¶

check parsed options [default: False]

--debug¶

show traceback on exceptions [default: False]

colors¶

cl_plot colors [OPTIONS]

create plot color palettes and formatted rgbs

Options

VALUE OPTIONS:

-outf <outf>¶

output file

FLAGS (DEFAULT TRUE):

--rgb, --no-tgb¶

print rgb values for radutil [default: True]

--ru, --mat¶

plot radutil colors (–mat plots matplotlib) [default: True]

FLAGS (DEFAULT FALSE):

--radf, --no-radf¶

print rgb values on 0-1 scale [default: False]

HELP:

-opts, --opts¶

check parsed options [default: False]

--debug¶

show traceback on exceptions [default: False]

heatmap¶

cl_plot heatmap [OPTIONS] DATAF

def plot_heatmap(fig, ax, data, colormap, vmin=None, vmax=None, DST=False, ticks=None, labels=None, **kwargs)

Arguments

DATAF¶

Required argument

Options

VALUE OPTIONS:

-alpha <alpha>¶

transparency for background [default: 0.5]

-background <background>¶

background image for graph area

-bg <bg>¶

background color [default: white]

-colors <colors>¶

cmap name* or space seperated list of rgb tuples 0,0,0 120,120,120 etc. if fewer than # series picks .from gradient includes ru_colors: ‘blu’, ‘org’, ‘pur’, ‘red’, ‘blg’, ‘mag’, ‘brn’, ‘grn’, ‘yel’, ‘ggr’, ‘dark’, ‘med’, ‘light’, ‘xlight’ [default: med]

-comment <comment>¶

regex “^[{}].*” indicating comment line indicator [default: #]

-dpi <dpi>¶

image dpi [default: 200]

-dpy <dpy>¶

days per year (x axis shape) [default: 365]

-drange <drange>¶

index range for data series, if None gets all

-fg <fg>¶

foreground color [default: black]

-gridc <gridc>¶

opacity of gridlines (color is bg) [default: 0.5]

-height <height>¶

image height [default: 5.0]

-hpd <hpd>¶

hours per day (y axis shape) [default: 24]

-labels <labels>¶

labels for legend

-lw <lw>¶

lineweight of grid around cells (try .5) [default: 0.5]

-outf <outf>¶

graph output file (defaults to basename of first dataf)

-plotidx <plotidx>¶

column idx of data to plot [default: -1]

-positions <positions>¶

if cmap is a list positions are the mapping points else positions are the sample points used to remap

-pph <pph>¶

data points per hour in annual data [default: 1]

-sh <sh>¶

start hour (24 hour time) [default: 0]

-step <step>¶

steps for color map

-ticks <ticks>¶

locations for legend labels (must be same # of items)

-vmax <vmax>¶

scale max

-vmin <vmin>¶

scale max

-width <width>¶

image width [default: 10.5]

FLAGS (DEFAULT TRUE):

--legend, --no-legend¶

include legend in plot [default: True]

FLAGS (DEFAULT FALSE):

--areaonly, --no-areaonly¶

only plot plot area, no legend or axes, for use as background [default: False]

--dst, --no-dst¶

shift data for DST [default: False]

--front, --no-front¶

plot background in front of data [default: False]

--ticklines, --no-ticklines¶

plot tick lines [default: False]

--weatherfile, --no-weatherfile¶

input files will be read as weather files: 0 month, 1 day, 2 hour, 3 dirnorn, 4 difhoriz, 5 globhoriz, 6 skycover [default: False]

HELP:

-opts, --opts¶

check parsed options [default: False]

--debug¶

show traceback on exceptions [default: False]

histo¶

cl_plot histo [OPTIONS] DATAF

plot histogram bar plot

arguments:

  • dataf: data file(s) to plot

Arguments

DATAF¶

Required argument

Options

VALUE OPTIONS:

-alpha <alpha>¶

transparency for background [default: 0.5]

-axes <axes>¶

enter as xname,xmin,xmax,yname,ymin,ymax - default usesmin and max of data enter xmin etc to maintain autoscale [default: X,0,1,Y,0,ymax]

-background <background>¶

background image for graph area

-bg <bg>¶

background color [default: white]

-bins <bins>¶

bins can be ‘auto’ an integer or a sequence1 2 3 4:12:2 14:16 = 1,2,3,4,6,8,10,14,15

-bottom <bottom>¶

use with polar to set bottom of y-axis same units as axes [default: 0.0]

-brange <brange>¶

defaults to min and max

-bwidth <bwidth>¶

relative width of bars [default: 0.8]

-colors <colors>¶

cmap name* or space seperated list of rgb tuples 0,0,0 120,120,120 etc. if fewer than # series picks .from gradient includes ru_colors: ‘blu’, ‘org’, ‘pur’, ‘red’, ‘blg’, ‘mag’, ‘brn’, ‘grn’, ‘yel’, ‘ggr’, ‘dark’, ‘med’, ‘light’, ‘xlight’ [default: med]

-comment <comment>¶

regex “^[{}].*” indicating comment line indicator [default: #]

-dpi <dpi>¶

image dpi [default: 200]

-drange <drange>¶

index range for data series, if None gets all

-ecolors <ecolors>¶

marker edge colors [default: 1,1,1]

-epositions <epositions>¶

if cmap is a list positions are the mapping pointselse positions are the sample points used to remap

-estep <estep>¶

steps for color map

-fcol <fcol>¶

colormap position for first color [default: 0.0]

-fg <fg>¶

foreground color [default: black]

-height <height>¶

image height [default: 5.0]

-labels <labels>¶

input custom series labels, by default uses file name and index or –header option

-outf <outf>¶

graph output file (defaults to basename of first dataf)

-positions <positions>¶

if cmap is a list positions are the mapping points else positions are the sample points used to remap

-rwidth <rwidth>¶

relative width of bars [default: 0.95]

-step <step>¶

steps for color map

-width <width>¶

image width [default: 10.5]

-xlabels <xlabels>¶

input custom xaxis labels, by default uses file name androw number or –xheader option

-xticks <xticks>¶

number of x-ticks/gridlines

-y_vals <y_vals>¶

index for yvals [default: -1]

-yticks <yticks>¶

number of y-ticks/gridlines

FLAGS (DEFAULT TRUE):

--legend, --no-legend¶

include legend in plot [default: True]

FLAGS (DEFAULT FALSE):

--areaonly, --no-areaonly¶

only plot plot area, no legend or axes, for use as background [default: False]

--front, --no-front¶

plot background in front of data [default: False]

--header, --no-header¶

indicates that data has a header row to get series labels (overridden by labels) [default: False]

--polar, --no-polar¶

plot on polar axes [default: False]

--rows, --no-rows¶

get data rows instead of columns [default: False]

--stacked, --no-stacked¶

make stacked bars [default: False]

--tails, --no-tails¶

include values below and above range in first and last bin(requires -brange) [default: False]

--ticklines, --no-ticklines¶

plot tick lines [default: False]

--weatherfile, --no-weatherfile¶

input files will be read as weather files: 0 month, 1 day, 2 hour, 3 dirnorn, 4 difhoriz, 5 globhoriz, 6 skycover [default: False]

--xgrid, --no-xgrid¶

plot x grid lines [default: False]

--xheader, --no-xheader¶

indicates that data has a header column to get x-axis labels (overridden by xlabels) [default: False]

--ygrid, --no-ygrid¶

plot y grid lines [default: False]

--ylog, --no-ylog¶

plot y on log scale [default: False]

HELP:

-opts, --opts¶

check parsed options [default: False]

--debug¶

show traceback on exceptions [default: False]

scatter¶

cl_plot scatter [OPTIONS] DATAF

arguments for x_vals and y_vals are a space seperated list of indices or index pairs. A single number is applied to all files, a comma seperated pair: i,j gets the jth column from the ith file. if a tuple x_val is given all y_data will share, else x will be index value from each file. for y_val entry a single number will grab from all files, a comma pair gets one column of data. use the argument -rows to get data by rows instead.

Arguments

DATAF¶

Required argument

Options

VALUE OPTIONS:

-alpha <alpha>¶

transparency for background [default: 0.5]

-autox <autox>¶

auto assign xvals between min,max from axes

-axes <axes>¶

enter as xname,xmin,xmax,yname,ymin,ymax - default usesmin and max of data enter xmin etc to maintain autoscale [default: X,xmin,xmax,Y,ymin,ymax]

-background <background>¶

background image for graph area

-bg <bg>¶

background color [default: white]

-bottom <bottom>¶

use with polar to set bottom of y-axis same units as axes [default: 0.0]

-c_vals <c_vals>¶

optional index for color vals, only uses 1 index

-cmax <cmax>¶

scale max for color

-cmin <cmin>¶

scale min for color

-colors <colors>¶

cmap name* or space seperated list of rgb tuples 0,0,0 120,120,120 etc. if fewer than # series picks .from gradient includes ru_colors: ‘blu’, ‘org’, ‘pur’, ‘red’, ‘blg’, ‘mag’, ‘brn’, ‘grn’, ‘yel’, ‘ggr’, ‘dark’, ‘med’, ‘light’, ‘xlight’ [default: med]

-comment <comment>¶

regex “^[{}].*” indicating comment line indicator [default: #]

-criteria <criteria>¶

plot markers based on criteria (either x=VAL or y=VAL)assumes single solution

-dpi <dpi>¶

image dpi [default: 200]

-drange <drange>¶

index range for data series, if None gets all

-ecolors <ecolors>¶

marker edge colors [default: 1,1,1]

-epositions <epositions>¶

if cmap is a list positions are the mapping pointselse positions are the sample points used to remap

-estep <estep>¶

steps for color map

-fcol <fcol>¶

colormap position for first color [default: 0.0]

-fg <fg>¶

foreground color [default: black]

-height <height>¶

image height [default: 5.0]

-labels <labels>¶

input custom series labels, by default uses file name and index or –header option

-lw <lw>¶

line weight if fewer than # series uses last [default: 2]

-mew <mew>¶

marker edge width [default: 0]

-mrk <mrk>¶

marker style if fewer than # series loops [default: o]

-ms <ms>¶

marker size if fewer than # series uses last [default: 0]

-outf <outf>¶

graph output file (defaults to basename of first dataf)

-pery <pery>¶

label y-axis by percentile with N bins

-positions <positions>¶

if cmap is a list positions are the mapping points else positions are the sample points used to remap

-step <step>¶

steps for color map

-weax <weax>¶

use months as x-axis (8760 data) give idx for month andday ex: 1 2 for epw 0 1 for weawhen using –weatherfile use 0 1 for both

-width <width>¶

image width [default: 10.5]

-x_vals <x_vals>¶

index for xvals [default: 0,0]

-xticks <xticks>¶

number of x-ticks/gridlines

-y_vals <y_vals>¶

index for yvals [default: -1]

-yticks <yticks>¶

number of y-ticks/gridlines

FLAGS (DEFAULT TRUE):

--legend, --no-legend¶

include legend in plot [default: True]

FLAGS (DEFAULT FALSE):

--areaonly, --no-areaonly¶

only plot plot area, no legend or axes, for use as background [default: False]

--flipxy, --no-flipxy¶

plot x on vertical axis [default: False]

--front, --no-front¶

plot background in front of data [default: False]

--header, --no-header¶

indicates that data has a header row to get series labels (overridden by labels) [default: False]

--polar, --no-polar¶

plot on polar axes [default: False]

--reverse, --no-reverse¶

reverse order of y data (sometimes useful with -autox) [default: False]

--rows, --no-rows¶

get data rows instead of columns [default: False]

--ticklines, --no-ticklines¶

plot tick lines [default: False]

--weatherfile, --no-weatherfile¶

input files will be read as weather files: 0 month, 1 day, 2 hour, 3 dirnorn, 4 difhoriz, 5 globhoriz, 6 skycover [default: False]

--xgrid, --no-xgrid¶

plot x grid lines [default: False]

--xlog, --no-xlog¶

plot x on log scale [default: False]

--ygrid, --no-ygrid¶

plot y grid lines [default: False]

--ylog, --no-ylog¶

plot y on log scale [default: False]

HELP:

-opts, --opts¶

check parsed options [default: False]

--debug¶

show traceback on exceptions [default: False]
